benchmark_details.name: DFIR-Metric (Digital Forensics and Incident Response Metric)
benchmark_details.overview: DFIR-Metric is a benchmark with three components: Knowledge Assessment with 700 expert-reviewed multiple-choice questions, Realistic Forensic Challenges with 150 CTF-style tasks, and Practical Analysis with 500 disk and memory forensics cases from the NIST Computer Forensics Tool Testing Program.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: Evaluate the theoretical knowledge and practical proficiency of LLMs in the domain of Digital Forensics and Incident Response.

data.source: Expert-reviewed questions sourced from industry-standard certifications and official documentation, forensic challenges based on real-world scenarios, and practical cases derived from the NIST CFTT.
data.size: 700 multiple-choice questions, 150 CTF-style challenges, 500 analysis cases
data.annotation: Human-verified and expert-reviewed multiple-choice questions and solutions.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated by assessing task performance across multiple attempts to ensure reliability.
methodology.interpretation: High scores indicate better understanding and accuracy in completing forensic tasks.
methodology.baseline_results: Highest scores achieved by models like GPT-4.1 in the DFIR context.
methodology.validation: The benchmark's components were validated through repeated testing by multiple evaluators.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All questions derived from publicly accessible sources with measures taken to avoid direct association with certification material.
